msItem.rubric: Nomina sacra; names of the donors (mostly in lilac ink); on the incipit page of each Gospel, a few lines are rubricated (alternating with black lines); chapter numbers and the word mǝʿǝraf; short postscript to the Gospel of Matthew; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.

msItem.note: Most of the traditional Introduction texts are missing.
Units of the Gospel text (mǝʿǝrafat and kǝflat) are systematically marked with Ethiopic numerals in the margins.

supportDesc.condition: The binding is broken (rebinding of the Ms. was probably attempted more than once); the Ms. has fallen apart into two parts, loosely connected to each other. The text is incomplete. Some folios are missing, folios containing the Canon tables are turned upside down. Fols. 166 and 167 are misplaced; their proper places are between fols. 32 and 33 (fol. 166) and between fols. 22 and 23 (fol. 167). Parchment guards in quire I originate from a different, older Ms. (15th cent.?).

The note states that the Ms. belongs to Qwǝrbanä Dǝngǝl and his wife Säbänä Giyorgis. Other persons listed include their mämḥǝr Qǝbʿa Krǝstos and their children. The genealogical part of the note is written in Amharic and apparently includes two distinct fragments, written in the same hand as the ownership note, but with two different kinds of red ink. The genealogical fragment mentions Doqǝma, a person also mentioned in the ownership note.

Fol. 168rb: Ownership note.Fol 168rb: ዝመጽሐፍ፡ ዘስልጣነ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ወዘጸሐፊሁኒ፡ አፈ፡ ክርስቶስ፨ ዘአጥረዮ፡ በንዋዩ፡ ዘሠረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ወዘተአገሎ፡ በኃይል፡ ዘሤጦ፡ ወዘተሣየጦ፡ ዘእንበለ፡ ፈቃዱ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዝ፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ፡ ለይኩን። Fol. 168rb: This is a book of Sǝlṭanä Krǝstos and of its scribe ʾAfä Krǝstos, who acquired it for his money. He who steals it or erases (its text), he who removes it by force, he who sells it or buys it without permission shall be excommunicated like Arius by the authority of Peter and Paul. The two upper lines of the note are rubricated.

- The title ወንጀል is crudely written on the boards. - The title of each Gospel is written in the upper margin of the respective incipit page (or under the heading), the letters (black and red alternating) being inserted between the red and black dot asterisks. - Back cover crudely inscribed (twice): ወንጌል፡ - Marginal comments in Gǝʿǝz in smaller script: fols. 52r, 53r, 54v, 55r, 55v, 56r, 57v, 59r, 61v, etc. - Quire I (fols. 1r-3v) has been sewn to the Ms. upside down. Parchment guards originating from a different Ms. (with text fragments still visible) are inserted between fols. 1 and 2 and after fol. 3. - Crude note, in the same ink and in the same hand as Additio 4 (writing exercise?): fol. 131v.

person.persName: The names of Gäbrä Ṣadǝq (fols. 4r, 52r, 82r) and Wäldä Mikaʾel, Kǝflä Giwärgis, Wälättä Mädḫǝn, Sǝlṭanä Krǝstos (fols. 52r, 132r) are written in a secondary hand. According to Additio 3, Gäbrä Ṣadǝq is the father of fitawrari Täwäldä Mädḫǝn (s. Owner).

The Ms. was apparently initially owned by Sǝlṭanä Krǝstos (Additio 6). Afterwards it passed to Qwǝrbanä Dǝngǝl and his wife Säbänä Giyorgis (Additio 5). The last recorded owner was fitawrari Täwäldä Mädḫǝn (Wäldu), his wife was wäyzäro Nǝrʾaya (Additiones 1-3).
